intro: Hieracium intercessum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium intercessum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
